session_summary: Jolene informed Deborah about her mini retreat last Wednesday, which gave her a new outlook on life and boosted her confidence. She discussed her engineering project accomplishments, focusing on green technology to help disadvantaged areas and her idea for a volunteer program teaching STEM to underprivileged kids. Deborah supported the idea, and Jolene mentioned plans to work with local schools/centers for workshops with guest speakers. Jolene shared sketches with Deborah, who offered further assistance if needed. They ended the conversation with mutual appreciation and well wishes.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Hey Deborah! Been a few days since we last talked so I wanted to fill you in on something cool. Last Wednesday I did a mini retreat to assess where I'm at in life. It was a dope experience that totally gave me a new outlook.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Hey Jolene! Sounds great. Taking time to reflect can be really awesome. Did you gain any new insights from it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Yep! I achieved so much more than I imagined. It was a real confidence boost.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: You deserve credit for stepping outside your comfort zone and believing in yourself. What cool stuff did you accomplish at the retreat?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I really accomplished something with my engineering project - I came up with some neat solutions and I'm really excited about it.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Green tech could really make a difference in disadvantaged areas. I'd like to look into it and see how I can contribute. Hey, speaking of helping out, I had an idea: a volunteer program where engineers teach STEM to underprivileged kids. What do you think of that?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: That sounds great, Jolene! It's a great way to help and inspire others. They would benefit a lot from your knowledge. Have you thought of a plan yet?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Haven't finished planning yet but I'm thinking of teaming up with local schools/centers to do workshops. We could even invite engineers as guest speakers to show kids their career options.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Having guest speakers, like them, would definitely give the kids a real-world view. Have you reached out to any schools or centers yet?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: No, not yet. I want to solidify the plan first. Can't wait to start reaching out, though!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: That makes sense. I'm excited to hear how you reach out and help those kids. Let me know how it goes!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a notebook with a pen and a notebook with a page of notes
conversation_turns.text: I'll keep you posted! Appreciate the support! Here are my sketches in the planner.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Sounds like you're doing great. Let me know if you need more tips or information.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Deb! If I need anything else, I'll let you know. You're awesome!

Jolene: Jolene reflects on her accomplishments and future by taking a mini retreat in life and comes up with some solutions for her engineering projects such as developing green tech for disadvantaged areas.
Jolene plans to start a volunteer program where engineers can teach STEM to underpriveleged kids by holding workshops at local schools.
Jolene uses a planner to note her ideas on the volunteer program and green tech.
Jolene did a mini retreat last Wednesday to assess her life and gained new insights and a confidence boost from it.
Jolene accomplished something significant with her engineering project and came up with neat solutions that she's excited about.
Jolene is considering looking into green technology to make a difference in disadvantaged areas.
Jolene had an idea for a volunteer program where engineers teach STEM to underprivileged kids.
Jolene plans to team up with local schools/centers to do workshops and invite engineers as guest speakers for the volunteer program.
Deborah: Deborah acknowledged Jolene for stepping outside her comfort zone and believing in herself.
Deborah supported Jolene's volunteer program idea and suggested that it's a great way to help and inspire others.
Deborah expressed excitement to hear about Jolene reaching out and helping underprivileged kids.
Deborah offered to provide more tips or information if Jolene needs them.
